headline: Cream Cheese Penguins
description: Just imagine a cute display of penguins, made with black olives, carrots and cream cheese! You can add scarves and hats by using fresh red pepper strips, or canned pimentos cut into different shapes. Use frilly toothpicks if you can.

video.description: Go beyond cute with adorable cream cheese penguins.
video.name: Cream Cheese Penguins

name: Cream Cheese Penguins

recipeInstructions.text: Cut a slit from top to bottom, lengthwise, into the side of each jumbo olive. Carefully insert about 1 teaspoon of cream cheese into each olive. Slice the carrot into eighteen 1/4 inch thick rounds; cut a small notch out of each carrot slice to form feet. Save the cut out piece and press into center of small olive to form the beak. If necessary cut a small slit into each olive before inserting the beak.

Set a big olive, large hole side down, onto a carrot slice. Then, set a small olive onto the large olive, adjusting so that the beak, cream cheese chest and notch in the carrot slice line up. Secure with a toothpick.

review.reviewBody: I used roasted peppers for the scarf thinly sliced!!! Came out awesome and everyone was complimenting them for looks and taste!!!
We loved the Cream Cheese Penguins. I made these penguins with my granddaughter. We had fun adding scarves and hats. I wouldn't change a thing on these penguins.

A real cocktail party hit! They are not difficult to make, but a bit of practice is helpful.

My only alteration was to spread room temp Cream Cheese on the bottom of the plate to simulate snow. This also gave me a base for holding up the penguins .

Loved it and got many kudos
I think these are so cute and easy to make. I made these several years ago using a jelly roll pan with a thin layer of cream cheese.
Made them last year. They are so cute. Even fthough they are tedious to make, I will be making them again this year.
I made something very similar for Christmas. Used small fresh mozz balls. These were a big hit!
I made something very similar for Christmas. Used small fresh mozz balls. These were a big hit!

I made these for Christmas appetizer. 
I allowed cream cheese to soften then placed in sandwich bag and squeezed into sliced olives. Was easier, faster and less messy. 
I used candy eyes. They looked adorable and stored standing up overnight in Fridge. Some fell over and they were a mess the next day. 
I would suggest cutting carrots (feet) thicker to help support them.

Thought they would be cute but was a disaster.
Would recommend not softening the cream cheese.
Got frustrated with the way they weren't coming together so won't make them.
Love this easy to make receipe. The penguins are a delightful addition to a holiday party table and were loved by all!
We had so much fun making them and eating them.
These were fun to make, and everyone thought they were super cute. my only complaint is that the cream cheese is hard to put into the olives and still look good, maybe a me problem idk.
Made these years ago for a New Year's Eve party. They are yummy and cute for kids too...were talked about for years after.
Everyone at the gathering loved them! I had a hard time making scarves, (I used Peppadews). In the future I will make a few to accent a veggie tray
A love it
I made these for my family and they proceeded to play with it. I will definitely be making again.
Cute and delicious

I made these last Autumn. I have never really done any of this cutesy stuff in a while because the kids are grown, but that doesn't mean you have to stop! But apparently, I did have to stop sending pictures of the army of penguins I was creating to my daughter....something about she was in class...maybe a test....she's going to block me....meh. They were super cute, and the taste was okay, but the taste was the secondary factor. I used chive and onion cream cheese and just had to do the roasted red pepper scarfs from a suggestion! Thank you! I'll have to prepare another army for this Holiday!
Eye candy, texture, taste and time required to make not worth my effort. Won’t make them again.
Cute as they can be but. Or as easy as it looks!

Great party appetizer. Just be forewarned, it's more effort than in might appear. My suggestions:

- Be sure to get Jumbo olives. Extra large are not all that big.

- Use flavored cream cheese or add some ranch dressing powder or other seasoning. Plain cream cheese is too plain.

- Making scarves is great, but it's a lot of work and the result can be good or bad. Better to just pipe some extra cream cheese which then flattens a bit when you affix the head, to create a sort of white scarf.

- Cut a little extra off the open end of each olive to make more room for piping the cheese in.

- Get big fat carrots. Carve the beaks out of the carrots before slicing them. It may end up being easier to use a different carrot for the beaks.

- Use neufchatel cheese. It pipes much easier.

- If this is going to be for an event that you want to impress folks, I highly suggest you make a practice run a week ahead of time.

Penguins were a huge hit at the holiday party! I used the whipped cream cheese and a Ziploc bag as others had described to fill the olives. Make sure you get the biggest olives you possibly can for the torso.

What a fun appetizer this is! It's great to take to someone else's home as it's a bit time consuming, so you don't have to worry about preparing a lot of other things!
I too used the chive & onion whipped cream cheese and put in a plastic bag with corner snipped. Worked great! Gave it a little rolling look to it too.
I will carry them to the party in a muffin tin, 2 to a spot, laying down for ease of transport.
awesome! everyone loved this.... it was cute and delish

These little penguins were so adorable! I was a little worried that the flavors would contrast, but they were super delicious. My family loved them and they were gone in a day! I will definitely make this recipe again as I had a lot of fun creating these little guys.
Fun to make and worth the effort but tedious. Good conversation starters and stand out on the table.
Adorable ! flavor the cream cheese however you like ...a bit of onion soup mix or ranch dressing or some onion and garlic powder takes time but Oh so cute!!!... good too
Definitely cute penguins! That’s about it. Time consuming, difficulty finding “the eyes” and only good if you LOVE black olives.
The video was very helpful! They are so cute!!!! Thanks for such a great idea and a “craft” I can actually do! They make me smile. Made ours nice and fat and left off the eyes.

I made these they were a bit time consuming but cute and very attention grabbing. Sent a photo to my mother and she could not figure out what they were

Hollywood in AZ
I’m not an olive fan, but my wife is and she loves these crafty sorts of foods to make. She loves these as do our guests.

I saw a similar recipe somewhere else and made them. They are time consuming, but fun to make. I used Mozzarella balls instead of the cream cheese and cut deli ham into long thin strips to make 'scarves'. No one at my family get together wanted to eat them because "they look to cute to eat" so I took them to work next day and everyone LOVED them! (those folks are not afraid of good looking food.)
These are adorable. I didn't want to mess with the cream chees but a small mozzarella cheese ball cut in half fit perfectly!! Making everything stay together better, I think.
It was a hit! Great idea and very edible for fussy little tikes.

These adorable penguins were fun to make and did take a little time but they were well worth it. They went so fast at the party that I didn't even get to have one! (I had to make more at home!) I even shared the recipe with a few others! Thanks!
My friends loves anything penguins so imagine her delight when I made these! Thank you for the recipe - they are so cute!!
Very impressive. You need a lot of patience but turned out to be a hit!
adorable and cool idea, delicious too. especially with 1/2 tsp garlic powder in cream cheese. ez and tastes better: slice orange cheesesticks for feet & beaks instead of carrots.
Easy to do and so cute!
Adorable, everyone loved them!
These were so adorable. They were the big hit on Christmas Eve. Everyone took photos before they ate one.
Easy to make, lots of fun to serve, and tastes great.

This is so cute and economical to make. Made them on Christmas Eve and had so much fun assembling them! 
 We used the onion & chive flavored cream cheese and shaved carrot strips for the scarves.
 I had a spare straw from a juice box and cut out buttons for the front.from shaving the bottoms of the jumbo olives.
 What a great idea! Worth the effort to make.
Thank you!

I made these few years ago for a Christmas party and they were a hit. It's an innovative way to get the kids to choose something a little healthier on the buffet table. I had so much fun taking pictures of them too...they're adorable.
Easy Peezie & too cute!
I had a lot of fun making them, but no one would eat them because they were "Too Cute!".
These are so cute, I also made an igloo with a cheese ball coated with cream cheese. Great for parties.

I made this about two years ago when my family was doing a finger food buffet style Christmas party, and everyone loved it! Making it again this year for me and my dad since we're doing finger foods (ironic since he hates penguins). I had a bit of trouble getting the cream cheese into the olives as they kept splitting more than intended and tearing at the sides, but the end result was so worth the mess. This year I'm going to use herbed cream cheese for an extra hint of flavor. Also, the pimento scarves are adorable but can actually be difficult to do, at least that was the hardest part for me. Worth it though!
I used a sweet red pepper for the scarf that I had pickled in with some habanero peppers to give it a little kick.

time consuming but awesome
dont cut the olives too much
These are SO cute! When I made them, to add something a little sweet, I cut the top off a strawberry and used that as a little party hat. I also attached candy eyes with cream cheese. So awesome!!!

I've made these twice now and they are always a big hit! they are a lot of work, but worth it for big parties. I've found that the carrot didn't add much taste and was too crunchy compared to the soft olive and cheese. last time I made them I substituted the carrot for orange pepper which really improved the taste and texture, and added some garlic and onion to the cream cheese. Now they're almost as delicious as they are adorable!
I was not sure about how they were going to taste (not being a fan of carrots), but I thought they would look adorable for me Christmas party. They were amazing and everyone loved them!

Talk about the Life of the Party! These little guys stole the show. People loved them so much they didn't want to eat them...Then I started Chowing and they were gone! I wouldn't add anything to the cream cheese, the olive and carrot was enough. Should have made more!

I have made these for Christmas for the last few years. My two oldest grandchildren love olives and were excited the first time I made them. Now they request them. I made them for my youngest granddaughter's first birthday party that was penguin themed. Her birthday is December 28th, so they were well received. I didn't change a thing, but I did use a piping bag to fill the larger olives with the cream cheese. Will definitely make these for years to come. Well worth the extra effort just to see peoples faces when they see them and hear them tell me how brilliantly creative I am.
They were hard to make, but it was worth it. We couldn't get the cream cheese in so we used a frosting bag to get it in. They didn't always stand up, but once we got them to, everyone loved them.
These turned out really cute, my niece was begging to eat them. I'm not an olive fan so didn't enjoy but glad she and the other little ones did

Excellent! So fun and well received. I did make one change --- we have a standing order in the house for our family cheese ball recipe.... I used that for the filling rather than the store bought cream cheese. A tip for folks that might want to try that option.... add a bit of sour cream and let the cheese ball set to room temp; makes it so much easier to fill these little cuties.

We did this for Thanksgiving and they were a big hit. They're as much about the conversation and comments as the eating.
Easy and fun!

I have to say my intention was to make several but I only made 1, however they are very cute, I love them. I also wish I would have gotten pimentos for the scarves because the red Pepper slices were too hard to manipulate around the little penguins neck. Great idea the kiddos love them!!
loved them, they are so much fun!
Super fun to make and even more fun to eat! Big hit! Thanks for sharing!
Cute and fun to make with my children.

These are adorable little guys and tasty. I presented them on a platter that was covered in cream cheese. I tinted some of the cream cheese with blue coloring and placed it on the platter with little swirls to look like waves. I piled the white cream cheese higher on the other side of the platter to represent the snow bank and covered the 'snow' with the penguins. I put single olives with the carrot noses in the water like they were swimming. Really cute. Crackers can be served with the platter to use up the 'water' and 'snow'.
Great Party Appetizer! But definitely use a flavored cream cheese. Too plain without it.

Cream Cheese Penguins Haiku: "5 stars for cuteness. More like 1 or 2 for taste. Tossed the leftovers." These are absolutely precious, and not as time-consuming to put together as I thought they'd be. My 1-year old's party was penguins, so of course I had to have this adorable army of penguins as an appetizer. I know my review won't be of any major assistance, considering all the helpful tips in the 100s of other reviews, but I'll go ahead and toss in my two cents: cream cheese should've been flavored, or at least had herbs added to it. These just tasted so boring! :( Also, to make it a bit easier: secure large olive to the carrot feet 1st, and then slide the head on - not as difficult as holding all 3 parts together and lining up a toothpick at once. And absolutely spooning the softened cream cheese into a baggy w/ the corner snipped off for piping is a HUGE help. They brought a smile to everybody's faces, but not to their bellies as there were tons that remained uneaten, but I am delighted to have made them anyways!

These are an awesome item, they were too cute though no one wanted to eat them.
I actually cut a piece out to make it easier for stuffing and was patience enough to the scarves but the were cute all the same.
Easy to make and very cute. No one ate any though. I don't think my family likes black olives.

This was really fun to bring to a party. My niece was turning one and had what else--a Frozen theme. Instead of carrots for the feet, I purchased a round block of cheese and shaped the feet appropriately. This meant that the penguins did not fall down at all, and the appetizer was tastier. I also made blue jello and had the penguins "skating." Adorable!
I made these fun to make takes time i used the recipe for the cucumber sandwiches to make the filling it was so good and cute.and put them on ice burgs. aka cucumber sandwiches.

These were so fun and gave me a chuckle every time I looked at them! I rinsed the canned olives, then soaked in balsamic vinegar to try and get the "tinny" flavor off, which helped a little. Other tips: mixed cream cheese and soft goat cheese together, added a little dry ranch to the cheese mix, used the tip of a star cookie cutter to cut out the carrot slices (easy and uniform) and used a pastry bag and large tip to pipe the cheese filling into the olives.
Tasty and adorable!

This is a great recipe! It was a huge hit at the party, and they are still talking about it, now I'm sorry I didn't make more penguins! I used a round piece of 1/4" foam, covered w/white tissue paper & covered that w/coconut. The penguins were stable & it was very easy to transport. It was a little time consuming, but well worth it. Thanks for sharing this recipe - I'm make it again.
So cute! Alot of work

We took this wonderful receipt to a get together in Florida in November It was a real hit! So cute and tasty. Everyone had a good laugh over the fact our penguins were enjoying a warm Florida get together. Deb
my super picky, chicken nuggets and French fries only, three year old grandson ate most of these and was looking for more

Definately the cutest thing I have ever made. Did use onion/chive cream cheese for the penguins to give it some flavor. Other than that it was easy to make but took a lot longer than I expected to put together. 

Placing the cream cheese in a ziplock bag made it easier to fill the olives since all I had to do was pipe it into the olive. Would make again.
So cute, and tasted good. Need big enough carrot to hold up penguin
I used a small sandwich bag to pipe the cream cheese. Was a hit for Christmas!!

I mixed Garlic and some green onion into the cream cheese, and used sharp cheddar cheese instead of the olives. I set aside a bit of the cream cheese to make sure the front of his tux is pure white though
Easy to make and a huge hit at the party! Thank you for sharing!!!!!
I used fresh buffalo matzerella instead of cream cheese. Less mess and it gave the breast a real look
Made these last Xmas for 1st time. Excellent. Friend made Igloo out of Cheese Ball and set penguins around it. Super

A little plain tasting on their own, but I tried making them one year with part of a leftover cheese ball (two blocks of cream cheese and one packet of Hidden Valley Ranch Powder mixed all up and then rolled in coarse pepper) and they were the bomb! I don't do the scarves because I'm allergic to capsicums.
Hubby loved these. Made him smile. Added a tiny amount of a ranch seasoning pack to the cream cheese for a little flavor. Thanks for the easy cute recipe.
These I have made before. I used a curly cocktail toothpick. Also have to make the igloo out of cheese ball for the penguins to sit around...
I have been making these for years. I also add dill and about 1/3 cup mayonaise to the cream cheese. Plus salt to taste.
Everyone loved these and easy to make. So cute placed them on a tray that looked like ice. Many asked if they could take a picture so they could make them in the future. Tasted yummy as well.
Just don't so them if your in a hurry unless your talented!! Very good and darling. Big hit but time consuming

This was really cute and fun!
Candy eyes from the cake decorating section at Walmart.
Cheese ball for igloo.
Cream cheese for snow.

Took these to a party and they were a great success! I had a lot of creme cheese left over so next time I would use 1/2 pkg cream cheese; Valley Ranch dry Spicy mix (maybe 1/3 pk to taste); sliced horizontal slot out of small olive for beak and cut slight amt out for body. Use frilly toothpicks. Made 21. Cut carrots little less than 1/4".
Yes was a big hit everyone loved them
Fun to make!
adorable easy, easily sub veggies on hand
so cute!!

Very clever. It's a labor of love. They taste fine, but it's not the taste you're after, it's the look! I used frilly toothpicks. I took them to a party and someone said, "That's the first time I've eaten penguin!" HA HA HA
They looked cute, but didn't go over very well. No one really wanted to eat them at our Christmas dinner. The grandkids all had one and the rest sat there, so I will not be making again.
Didn't make them, just thought they were cute.
Didn't make them, just thought they were cute.
